ygData.subject: Re: bazaar
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, my job is great for playing. I work 12 hour days, but only three days one week and four the next, on two week pay periods. That means I only have to
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, my job is great for playing. I work 12 hour days, but only
three days one week and four the next, on two week pay periods. That
means I only have to work 14 days a month.

The downside is that on work days I have time for work, eating,
commuting and sleeping, but for little else. I usually log on for
about one hour on those days and work on trade skills. Often too
tired to do even that.

On the days off I am not babysitting my grandchildren I can have nice
long sessions.

As for vacations, I earn vacation at a high rate and often have to
take days off just to burn the time. If I don't use it, I lose it.

If I take one of my three day weeks off I burn only 36 hrs. and get
10 days off.

I don't have the stamina to do 10 or 12 hr. sessions, but can do
three 3 hr. sessions a day on some days off.

This is great, but if I retire I can play all of the time. None of
that wasted time working. After a great many years of working I can
say definitively that work sucks. Gaming is far better.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., Toni <silly_girl4ever@y...> wrote:
>
> You could always do what my boyfriend does... He works most of
the year (he's a software engineer {contractor}) then he takes a few
months off during the summer =D It's awsome. We've had a great time
Leveling our characters & playing neverwinter nights
> Kat
> Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...> wrote: The last line Barto, IS
CLASSIC,
>
> MAN that was way too funny.
>
> Let me know when you do, I'll join ya.....hahahah
>
>
>
> --- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@c...> wrote:
> > Went there this morning to set up some sales. Lag
> > was terrible. It
> > was hard to even get my cursor on target. I suppose
> > it will be ok
> > once I get set up to sell, but the set up is
> > terrible. Move cursor.
> > Not on object. Move a bit more. Not on object. Move
> > back. Click.
> > Don't have object. Click again. Hmph. Had object but
> > didn't know it,
> > and just put it back. Click...
> >
> > Took so long that I didn't finish setting up before
> > I had to log. I
> > wouldn't have logged if I could have left my toon to
> > do business
> > while I was gone, but no such luck.
> >
> > I just gotta get another machine, faster connection,
> > and retire from
> > my job so that I can play all the time.
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
> >
> >
>
>
